projects.title: A Summa Philosophy Project on Sexual Desire

materials.label: Paper
materials.path: assets/phil of person final project summa.pdf

projects.texts:
What is Summa Theologiae?

From Wikipedia: "The Summa Theologiae, as the well-known work of Thomas Aquinas, is a compendium of all of the main theological teachings of the Catholic Church, intended to be an instructional guide for Theology students."

Structure for a Summa project: A general question, an article (topic), two or three objections to the author's own statement, "on the contrary" which cites words or works of an expert in this area to support the author's own opinion, "I answer that" part which stats the author's own opinion, and the author's reply to all the previously stated objections.

About This Project

There are two articles: one is "Is sexual desire moral?" and the other is "Is sexual activity moral?". I will talk abouttwo objections for each article and state my own idea.

projects.title: Mental Disorder and the Criminal-justice System
projects.texts:
Issue Discussed

The cause and mechanism of a psychiatric disease , also known as a mental disorder, is far more complex than what most people think. The case for each specific patient, moreover, is also highly disparate from one another. It is even a mystery that whether a psychiatric professional can really examine if one is faking to be mentally ill while in fact he is healthy. How does such a highly underdeveloped area of study involved in the criminal-justice system of the United States? Should people who are mentally ill be exculpated? Even so, are psychiatric criminals really treated this way nowadays?
